page.title: 05Homestead Farm Silage
page.content: {Mr. Priddle}is the farmer at {Homestead Farm}at{Newbridge.}He took us up through the fields in his pick_up truck to see where they were cutting the grass for{silage. They cut three times a year - in May, in July and again later. They cut about 12 acres in a day. The grass is cut with a mower.A harvester sucks it up and loads it into a trailer and it is taken away to the{silage clamp}in the farmyard where it is packed into a solid heap. The silage is covered with plastic sheets. Old tyres are put on top to keep the air out. Any field that does'nt produce as much silage as the rest is{ploughed}up and{re-seeded}in August and September (15-20 acres each year). The manure from the farmyard is put on the re-seeded fields.
